title: Assistive Gardening Tools | From the Ground Up

tasks.task: Research and select gardening tools for individuals with accessibility issues.
subtasks: Identify tools with arched handles for better leverage.
Look for tools with longer handles for wheelchair or standing use.
Check for extendable handles for adjustable reach.
Consider hand tools designed for ground-level access to shrubbery.
Find watering tools for standing, sitting, or overhead plant watering.
Visit garden centers to shop for accessibility tools.
Order tools from online suppliers if needed.

tasks.task: Understand available options for gardening tools with accessibility features.
